IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: 23-MSP-021955 12961 Ridgely Rd, Greensboro, Caroline County, MD TROOPER FIRST CLASS R. FISHER #7274 MARYLAND STATE POLICE - EASTON BARRACK Maryland State Police (MSP) marked patrol vehicle I-41 is equipped with a mobile video recording device. Axon Body Worn Camera operational. Stop recorded. Defendant: Douglas Lisonbee Roden. Maryland Soundex: R-350-149-522-126. Date of Birth:02/17/1979. Date of Arrest:06/19/2023. Time of Arrest: 0054. Subsequent Offender: Yes DUI #23-58-129 Narrative: On Monday, June 19, 2023, at approximately 0037 hours, I, TFC. Fisher #7274, was on routine uniform patrol operating MSP marked patrol vehicle I-41 in the area of 12961 Ridgely Rd, Greensboro, Caroline County, Maryland, conducting routine traffic enforcement. VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1) On the date of the incident, the weather was clear with approximate temperature of 70 degrees. At this time, I was traveling southbound on Ridgely Rd just North of Holly Rd. I observed a vehicle traveling northbound on Ridgely Rd approaching my location that appeared to be traveling well above the speed limit (50 MPH). I activated my Kustom Golden Eagle II Radar Unit into forward front facing mode, and captured the vehicles speed at 102 MPH in a posted 50 MPH zone. The vehicle in question was the only vehicle in the direct line of sight of my radar unit. I am certified to use this radar unit, the unit was tested before and after my shift, found to be working properly. I made a U-turn never losing sight of the vehicle, eventually catching up to the vehicle in the area of 12961 Ridgely Rd, Greensboro, MD. I identified the vehicle as a Gray Chevrolet Silverado bearing MD registration 91676CK. I activated my emergency equipment conducting a traffic stop in the area of 12961 Ridgely Rd. PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2) I made contact with the driver and sole occupant, who was identified as Douglas Lisonbee Roden (DOB: 02/17/1979, 2/M) via his MD drivers license. While collecting Rodens drivers license and vehicle information Caroline County 911 Center dispatched a BOLO (Be On The Lookout) for Roden and his vehicle. Rodens wife contacted 911 stating Roden is intoxicated and driving erratically, excessing speeds of 100 MPH. I advised the MSP Easton Barrack I have the BOLO vehicle that was dispatched. I immediately detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from his breath. I observed Roden to have droopy bloodshot watery eyes, slow thick slurred speech, lack of coordination, slow movements, he was overly apologetic, and visibly upset.I question Roden about the events that transpired this evening and why his wife was contacting 911 concerned about his wellbeing. Roden advised he has had a tough two weeks dealing with relationship and infidelity issues with his wife. He stated he turned to alcohol to help cope and he has a drinking problem. Roden admitted he has consumed about 5-6 12 oz Corona beer bottles in a few hours while he was driving. I observed one (1) 12oz glass Corona Bottle in the driver door pocket next to Roden that was still cold to the touch. PRE- ARREST SCREENING (PHASE 3) Based on the above stated information, I turned off my front facing emergency equipment, and I asked Roden to perform the Standardized Field Sobriety Tests (SFSTs). Medical PRE- SCREENING: The weather condition at the time was clear, dark with lighting provided by the street lights, and my patrol vehicle, it was approximately 70 degrees. My patrol vehicles forward-facing emergency equipment was deactivated prior to administering the tests.Roden appeared to be in good physical condition and did not display any physical injuries. Roden was wearing a red t-shirt, blue jeans, and black sneakers. Roden does not wear glasses or contacts. I asked Roden if he took any drugs or medication to which he statedno.I asked Roden if he suffered from any injuries, he advised no. I asked Roden if he was able to walk a straight line and lift his leg in the air to which he responded yes. HORIZONTAL GAZE NYSTAGMUS (6/6 clues observed): Rodens pupils were equally sized.Roden presented equal tracking. Lack of Smooth Pursuit: Present in both eyes. Distinct and Sustained Nystagmus at Maximum Deviation- Present in both eyes. Onset of Nystagmus Prior to 45 Degrees- Present in both eyes. *Vertical Gaze Nystagmus- Not detected * Roden had to be reminded multiple times to keep his head straight and use only his eyes. WALK AND TURN (4/8 clues observed): Instructional phase: Nothing observed. Walking Phase: First nine steps- margin-bottom:11px">Missed heel to toe on steps 1, 2 margin-bottom:11px">Stepped off line on steps 1, 2 margin-bottom:11px">Stopped walking on step 9 margin-left:16px">Improper turn Second nine steps- margin-bottom:11px">Missed heel to toe and steps 1, 2 margin-left:16px">Stepped off line on steps 1, 2 ONE LEG STAND (2/4 clues observed) Instructional Stage: No clues detected. Roden raised his right foot. Balance and Counting Stage: Seconds 0-10: Roden swayed. Seconds 11-20 Roden raised arm. Roden swayed. Seconds 21-30: margin-left:8px">Roden swayed. PRELIMINARY BREATH TEST: font-variant-ligatures:normal; text-decoration-thickness:initial; text-decoration-style:initial; text-decoration-color:initial" /> Roden took a preliminary breath test with a result of a .15 BrAC at approximately 0050 hours on the roadside. ARREST: Based on the following, I had the reason to believe Roden was operating a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol: Observed bloodshot, watery, and glassy eyes. Observed slurred speech. Observed slow movements confusion, and inability to follow directions. Detected an odor of an alcoholic beverage emitting from breath and person inside of and outside of the vehicle. Admission to consuming alcohol. Admission to consuming alcohol while driving. Admission of knowing he was doing something wrong. margin-left:8px">Observations during Standardized Field Sobriety Tests. It should be noted, during my interaction with Roden he voluntarily advised, he knew he was in the wrong and he needs to get a handle on his alcoholism. He also thanked me multiple times stating I probably saved his life. Roden was placed under arrest at approximately 0054 hours. Roden was played an English audio recording through the MVAs website and provided an English copy of his DR-15 Advice of Rights to follow along with. Roden AGREED to take an Intoximeter test at 0110 hours, and signed the DR-15 Advice of Rights. Roden was transported to the Caroline County Sheriffs Office, located at 9305 Double Hills Road. Denton,MD21629. Intox: .11 grams of alcohol per 210 liters of breath Case closed by arrest. All events occurred in Caroline County, Maryland.
